description: Replacement of windows from timber painted single glazed window to timber painted double glazed windows
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the application documents: 2310-P/P/02 PROPOSED SIDE ELEVATION, 2310-P/EX/02 EXISTING SIDE ELEVATION, 2310-P/EX/01 EXISTING FRONT ELEVATION, 2310-P/P/01 PROPOSED FRONT ELEVATION, 2310-P/W-F/01 WINDOW SCHEDULE FRIST FLOOR, 2310-P/P/03 PROPOSED REAR ELEVATION, 2310-P/W-G/01 WINDOW SCHEDULE GROUND FLOOR, 2310-P/DL-W/01 CROSS SECTION DETAILS, 2310-P/EX/03 EXISTING REAR ELEVATION, 2310-P/DL-W/02 CROSS SECTION DETAILS, 2310-P/L&S/01 LOCATION & SITE PLANS.
Reason: For avoidance of doubt and in the interest of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building, unless otherwise stated in the submitted application form or approved drawings.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023).

| Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995 (as amended), no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the building permitted.

Reason:  To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties and the visual appearance of the area, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and policies D3, D4 and D6 of the London Plan (2021).
